articles.author: Ellen Barry
articles.title: Survey of Americans Who Attempted Suicide Finds Many Aren’t Getting Care - The New York Times
articles.description: The number of people who try suicide has risen steadily in the U.S. But despite gains in health coverage, nearly half are not getting mental health treatment.
articles.content: Since people who try suicide have a higher likelihood of making another attempt in the next six months compared with the general population, the barriers to treatment are particularly troubling, he s… [+1424 chars]

articles.description: Satellite streaks aren't yet a huge problem, but they're bound to increase as SpaceX and other companies launch more low-Earth orbiting satellites, the American Astronomical Society says.

articles.title: China ‘will issue visas’ for US Olympic delegation despite diplomatic boycott - South China Morning Post
articles.description: List of 18 American officials seeking visas for the Beijing-hosted Winter Games has expanded to 46, which will be approved, according to a source.
